text: If life gives you lemons, squeeze them in your enemy’s eyes.
author: Anonymous

text: I’m not lazy, I’m on energy-saving mode.
author: Internet

text: You miss 100% of the naps you don’t take.
author: Sleep Enthusiast

text: Normal is just a setting on the dryer.
author: Patsy Clairmont

text: Reality continues to ruin my life.
author: Bill Watterson

text: Life is short. Smile while you still have teeth.
author: Mall Sign

text: When life shuts a door, open it again. It’s a door. That’s how they work.
author: Unknown

text: I like work: it fascinates me. I can sit and look at it for hours.
author: Jerome K. Jerome

text: Behind every great man is a woman rolling her eyes.
author: Jim Carrey

text: Don’t take life too seriously. You’ll never get out of it alive.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: I used to think I was indecisive, but now I’m not so sure.
author: Unknown

text: Life is hard. It’s even harder if you’re stupid.
author: John Wayne

text: When in doubt, mumble.
author: Unknown

text: Better to remain silent and be thought a fool than to speak out and remove all doubt.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Common sense is like deodorant. The people who need it most never use it.
author: Internet

text: I am an early bird and a night owl… so I am wise and I have worms.
author: Michael Scott

text: If at first you don’t succeed, then skydiving definitely isn’t for you.
author: Steven Wright

text: Alcohol: because no great story ever started with someone eating a salad.
author: Anonymous

text: Don’t worry if plan A fails. There are 25 more letters in the alphabet.
author: Claire Cook

text: I’m writing a book. I’ve got the page numbers done.
author: Steven Wright

text: I always arrive late at the office, but I make up for it by leaving early.
author: Charles Lamb

text: The road to success is dotted with many tempting parking spaces.
author: Will Rogers

text: Some cause happiness wherever they go; others whenever they go.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Never put off till tomorrow what you can do the day after tomorrow just as well.
author: Mark Twain

text: I can resist everything except temptation.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: You can’t have everything. Where would you put it?
author: Steven Wright

text: If you think nobody cares if you’re alive, try missing a couple of payments.
author: Earl Wilson

text: To steal ideas from one person is plagiarism; to steal from many is research.
author: Wilson Mizner

text: Insanity is hereditary; you get it from your children.
author: Sam Levenson

text: Some people just need a high-five. In the face. With a chair.
author: Internet

text: Why be moody when you can shake your booty?
author: Internet

text: If you’re going through hell, keep going. Or at least stop to roast some marshmallows.
author: Modified Churchill

text: I childproofed my house, but somehow they still get in.
author: Unknown

text: Never trust math teachers who say this will be easy.
author: Student Wisdom

text: Always borrow money from a pessimist. They won’t expect it back.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Sometimes I drink water to surprise my liver.
author: Internet

text: Money can’t buy happiness, but it can buy ice cream, and that’s pretty close.
author: Internet

text: I used to be a people person, but people ruined that for me.
author: Internet

text: I’m on a whiskey diet. I’ve lost three days already.
author: Tommy Cooper

text: Knowledge is knowing a tomato is a fruit; wisdom is not putting it in a fruit salad.
author: Miles Kington

text: If you can’t dazzle them with brilliance, baffle them with bullshit.
author: W.C. Fields

text: Dance like nobody’s watching. Because they’re not, they’re staring at their phones.
author: Internet

text: Light travels faster than sound. This is why some people appear bright until you hear them speak.
author: Alan Dundes

text: I told my wife she should embrace her mistakes. She gave me a hug.
author: Unknown

text: The early bird might get the worm, but the second mouse gets the cheese.
author: Steven Wright

text: If you think you are too small to be effective, you have never been in the dark with a mosquito.
author: Betty Reese

text: Some days you’re the pigeon, some days you’re the statue.
author: Internet

text: Change is inevitable—except from a vending machine.
author: Robert C. Gallagher

text: Don’t drink to forget, drink to obliterate the memory completely.
author: Party Animal

text: If life was fair, Elvis would be alive and all the impersonators would be dead.
author: Johnny Carson
